snippet: The Libyan ground offensive, led by a brigade from the city of Misurata, has gradually closed in on Surt, a coastal town nearby, from the west and south.
abstract: Libyan forces allied with country's United Nations-backed government surprise observers with their success against Islamic State stronghold in coastal city of Surt; American military officials, who were in midst of planning their own assault, are guardedly optimistic about offensive.

byline.original: By DECLAN WALSH and SULIMAN ALI ZWAY
byline.contributor: Declan Walsh reported from Cairo, and Suliman Ali Zway from Berlin. Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The Libyan ground offensive, led by a brigade from the city of Misurata, has gradually closed in on Surt, a coastal town nearby, from the west and south.

headline.main: U.N.-Backed Libyan Fighters Push Toward ISIS Stronghold of Surt
headline.print_headline: Libyan Fighters Backed by U.N. Press Toward the ISIS Stronghold of Surt

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
